result.execSummary:
The defendant Bobby Daniel Ryan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges by 05-24-19 or, if not paid, serve 5 days in HOC, consecutive to any sentence.
Consecutive to: Any other sentence; Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work and work search

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bobby Daniel Ryan

records.addlTxt: Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($500 sig bond) gj
Letter from Bobby Ryan, received and filed.

Defendant Bobby Daniel Ryan in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Bobby Daniel Ryan in custody.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.   The Court ordered the Defendant to serve  three months  in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 0 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work and work search. 

Court ordered defendant to pay all mandatory  court costs, fees  and surcharges by 5-24-2019  or, if not paid, serve 5  days in the House of Correction consecutive  to any sentence .

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court, defendant Bobby Daniel Ryan not in court, in custody.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 24, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court, defendant Bobby Daniel Ryan not in court, in custody.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Justice point report received and filed. Court preapproves transfer to br 19 for global resolution if accepted.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 47.  Status conference scheduled for April 19, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ALL Boston Store locations in Milwaukee County

Defendant Bobby Daniel Ryan in court with attorney Jessica Bellows.  Defendant Bobby Daniel Ryan in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 23, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 500.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Bobby Daniel Ryan not in court.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 1-13-2016 at 1:30pm
